options.title: No parts
options.description:
Choose **No parts** if you don't currently have the spare parts
and consumables required for the procedure. You can come back
with the parts later, or order them.

options.title: No tools
options.description:
Choose **No tools** if you don't have the required tools or other
equipment (like lifting equipment) needed to finish the repairs.
You can come back later, or ask for support.

options.title: No time
options.description:
Choose **No time** if working hours are over, or if you have
another appointment you must keep, and you will come back for this later.

options.title: No skills
options.description:
Choose **No skills** if you do not have the required training or
certification to complete this procedure, or if you need the
help of others to complete it.

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/release-esb-ch.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.title: Replace ESB

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Replace the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Unbolt the plastic nut from the back of the ESB
Pull the ESB from the front of the CP
Put a new ESB into the empty ESB slot
Bolt the plastic nut onto its bolt at the back of the ESB
Plug the contact of the ESB into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Close the left front panel
steps: Close the panel
Fix the latch
Screw back the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

processes.title: Turn the power off
steps: Twist the power switch 90° anti-clockwise ⤿

steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Check the contacts on the ESB
steps:
Check the conductivity of the contact sockets with short-circuit test
by inserting the multimeter leads into the contact sockets or the contact
screws and testing for both positions of the contact switch. The contact
should be in short-circuit when the switch is in open position (unpressed)
and the contrary in closed position (pressed)

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.title: Replace ESB contact

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Replace the contact on the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Plug the new ESB contact into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/check-emergenc.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

we60/general/left-panel-close.title: Close the left front panel
steps: Close the panel
Fix the latch
Screw back the two fixing screws on the left edge

we60/general/power-on.title: Turn the power on
steps: Twist the power switch 90° clockwise ⤾
